Section.Catchline: Florida Uniformed Servicemembers Protection Act; rights of servicemembers; incorporation by reference.

Subsection.Text: It is the intent of the Legislature to ensure that those individuals affected by the provisions of the Florida Uniformed Servicemembers Protection Act be made aware of the rights and responsibilities of servicemembers. The Department of Military Affairs shall make available a document containing the rights and responsibilities of servicemembers set forth in Florida Statutes, either through printed or electronic means, to appropriate state or local organizations composed of parties affected by said rights, including, but not limited to, those representing:

Paragraph.Text: Members of The Florida Bar Association who serve on a military affairs-related committee.

Subsection.Text: The Department of Military Affairs shall also make available a document containing the rights and responsibilities of servicemembers set forth in Florida Statutes, either through printed or electronic means, to servicemembers and their families.

Such documents containing the rights and responsibilities of servicemembers set forth in this act shall include an enumeration of all rights and responsibilities under state and federal law, including, but not limited to:

Paragraph.Text: The rights and responsibilities provided by the Florida Uniformed Servicemembers Protection Act, including a listing of all sections of Florida Statutes relating to servicemembers.
The rights and responsibilities provided by the Servicemembers Civil Relief Act.
The rights and responsibilities provided by the Uniformed Servicemembers Employment and Reemployment Rights Act.
